Sir Isaac Newton

An Anomoly of All Human Kind

Portrait of Isaac Newton at 46, painted by Godfrey Kneller in 1689


Here's a timeline of Isaac Newton's life:

  • 1642 - Isaac Newton is born on Christmas Day in 1642 in Woolsthorpe, Lincolnshire, England.
  • 1653 - Newton attends King's School in Grantham. This school could be thought of as a type of "middle-school". One thing many people do not know about Sir Isaac Newton was that he was a very successful student.
  • 1661 - Newton enrolls at Cambridge University, at the age of 16. He decided to do this when his mother took him out of middle school and tried to make him work on a farm. He decided studying sounded like it would be a more pleasant way for him to spend his time.
  • 1665 - Newton receives a bachelor's of arts degree, he is now 20 years old.
  • 1666 - Newton returns to Woolsthorpe. Cambridge University closed down due to the black plague, forcing him to quarantine in his old home. This is where his experiments with the origin of colors and the nature of gravity.
  • 1666 - Newton Invented Calculus to solve problems in his experiments.
  • 1667 - Newton returns to Cambridge to finish his master of arts degree.
  • 1669 - Newton Becomes a professor of mathematics at Cambridge.
  • 1671 - Newton joins the Royal Society of London after creating an improved version of the reflecting telescope.
  • 1687 - Newton Publishes Pricipia, inspired by the motion of a planet, this research paper turned into a three-volums book which contains his three laws of universal gravitation.
  • 1689 - Newton is elected to Parliament, serves for one year.
  • 1693 - Newton's health begins to whither, his mind begins to wander and his body is failing. People suspect he was going mad, or possibly experienced mercury poisoning over the years.
  • 1700 - Newton appointed Master of the Mint after working as Mint Warden for three years.
  • 1703 - Newton becomes president of the Royal Society.
  • 1705 - Newton is knighted as the first scientist to recieve the highest honor in the land. Now is known as Sir Isaac Newton.
  • 1727 - On March 20, 1727, Sir Isaac Newton died in his sleep. He will be remembered as a brilliant man, and his work continues to influence science and math today.

"To myself I am only a child playing on the beach, while vast oceans of truth lie uncovered before me."

-- Sir Isaac Newton


If you have time, you should read more about this incredible human being on his Wikipedia entry.
